sentences.english: However, the Chinese embassy in Syria did not charge any fee for assisting the evacuation of the overseas Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 我驻叙使馆在协助侨胞撤离过程中未收取任何费用。

sentences.english: Foreign entrepreneurs and overseas Chinese are welcome to invest in Huangshan.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎各国企业家，海外侨胞来黄山投资。

sentences.english: Foreign broadcasts in expatriate communities were suspended for the days of mourning.
sentences.chinese: 所有面向海外侨胞团体广播均在哀悼期间暂停。

sentences.english: How many of them have left Lebanon with the assistance of the Chinese government?
sentences.chinese: 已经有多少侨胞在政府的协助下离开？

sentences.english: Why are the remaining overseas Chinese reluctant to leave Lebanon?
sentences.chinese: 留下的侨胞主要是因为什么原因不愿撤离？

sentences.english: This has helped to affect the enthusiasm of overseas Chinese communities' in building their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 这些都挫伤了海外侨胞侨团建设家乡的积极性。

sentences.english: The Overseas Chinese made outstanding contributions to Chinas war of resistance.
sentences.chinese: 海外侨胞为祖国抗战作出了突出的贡献。

sentences.english: Haha, my English is poor, so please forgive me of all overseas Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，我的英语水平差，所以请各侨胞们见谅。

definition: family members of nationals residing abroad
overseas Chinese/(in a restricted sense) Chinese emigrant who still retains Chinese nationality/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
Chinese person who returns to China after living as an expatriate
matters relating to the Chinese diaspora (as a concern of the Chinese government)
consulate general/same as 總領事館|总领事馆[zong3 ling3 shi4 guan3]
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
